item.title: James add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "I read," I say. "I study and read. I bet I've read everything you read. Don't think I haven't. I consume libraries. I wear out spines and ROM-drives. I do things like get in a taxi and say, "The library, and step on it." My instincts concerning syntax and mechanics are better than your own, I can tell, with all due respect. But it transcends the mechanics. I'm not a machine. I feel and believe. I have opinions. Some of them are interesting. I could, if you'd let me, talk and talk." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: James add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "Our imagination flies -- we are its shadow on the earth." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: James add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "You can always count on a murderer for a fancy prose style." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: James add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Just the omission of Jane Austen's books alone would make a fairly good library out of a library that hadn't a book in it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: James add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Everything has been figured out, except how to live." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: James add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: James add a quote by Voltaire
item.description:
"I have never made but one prayer to God, a very short one: Oh Lord, make my enemies ridiculous. And God granted it."
(<i>Letter to Étienne Noël Damilaville</i>, May 16, 1767)" -- Voltaire

item.title: James add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: James add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I try to make everyone's day a little more surreal." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: James add a quote by Tom McCarthy
item.description: "All great enterprises are about logistics. Not genius or inspiration or flights of imagination, skill or cunning, but logistics." -- Tom McCarthy
